trans-unit.source: Represents the geometry of a line.

To create multiple connected lines, use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineSegment> or <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Polyline> segment with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry> classes.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the LineGeometry class provides several special features: LineGeometry objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.
For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> class that has no length.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> class that has the specified start and end points.
The start point of the line.
The end point of the line.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> class.
The start point.
The end point.
The transformation to apply to the line.
Gets the axis-aligned bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref>.
This property does not take into account the area potentially added by a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen>.
The axis-aligned bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets the end point of a line.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The end point of the line.
The default is (0,0).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry.EndPoint*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the area of the filled region of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> object.
The computational tolerance of error.
The specified type for interpreting the error tolerance.
The area of the filled region of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> object, which is always 0 because a line contains no area.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> object is empty.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> is empty; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> object can have curved segments.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry"></xref> object can have curved segments; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the start point of the line.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The start point of the line.
The default is (0,0).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry.StartPoint*> dependency property.
To be added.
